content: look completely seam- for examples less see resources below for help brim 1 roll knit 6 rnds transfer 26 30 34 sts to first dpn and the rest of brim 2 garter p1 round k1 round twice p1 round the sts to second dpn you are now ready to graft brim 3 rib k2 p2 for 4 rnds when you are finished leave a 10 tail to create the ear change to st st knit every st until hat measures approx 5 5 5 6 from co for roll brim style note if you choose to you can skip using the measure from the bottom of the roll as it lies - dpns and graft sts together using your circs and don t unroll it and then measure magic loop style note it may seem tall for a baby hat but when sewing you make the ears the fabric will gather and the hat will shorten bobble all sts and sew the seam at the top shut leave a 10 tail to create the ear note this is an easier method than grafting but you will have a visible seam at the top of the hat resources grafting http //knitty com/issuesummer04/feattheresasum 04 html sea monkey baby hat pg 4 1 2 ears step 1 once your seam is closed thread the tail on your tapestry needle and insert it from the inside approx 3 75 cm / 1 5 from the corner at the top of the hat and pull through step 2 wrap the yarn tightly around the corner of the hat a few times pulling the ear into shape as you go step 3 tie off repeat for the second ear attaching a piece of 3 yarn at the same point on the opposite side weave in ends if the ends from your ears are secure you can just pull them into the ear without weaving them abbreviations pg 5 approx = approximately pm = place marker beg = beginning prev = previous bobble = bind off psso = passover bor = beginning of round pu = pick up cc = contrasting colour pwise = purlwise chain = chain rem = remaining circ s = circular needle s repeat = repeat cn = cable needle rev st st = reverse stockinette stitch co = cast on round s = round s cont = continue rs = right side double_crochet = double_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet dpn s = double pointed needle s skip = skip decrease s = decrease s skp = slip one stitch knit one stich pass slipped stitch foll = follow ing over knitted stitch decrease half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet sl = slip hk = hook sl1k = slip one stitch knitwise increase = increase sl1p = slip one stitch purlwise incl = including sl m = slip marker k = knit space s = space s k2tog = knit two stitches together decrease ssk = slip slip knit two slipped stitches together kfb = knit into
